main event: A sighting of a single high-speed light observed in Oklahoma City on 12/2/57, which was determined to be the Sputnik rocket.
interesting points: The object appeared as a steady light that disappeared like a star,It was the size of a head of a pin, observed to be traveling very high and fast,Another light was seen blinking on and off at five-second intervals,The sighting lasted for about 15 seconds and was conducted visually without optical aids.
witness description: an elderly couple, both 65 years old
